content.statement: aaa-007-screening is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aaa that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aaa-007-screening helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aaa-007-screening include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aaa-007-screening.

definitions_glossary.screening: Testing asymptomatic individuals to detect disease early
definitions_glossary.uspstf: US Preventive Services Task Force - independent panel making prevention recommendations
definitions_glossary.grade_b: High certainty of moderate benefit or moderate certainty of high benefit
definitions_glossary.grade_c: Moderate benefit for selected patients, individual decision-making
definitions_glossary.grade_i: Insufficient evidence to assess benefits and harms
definitions_glossary.grade_d: Evidence of no benefit or harms outweigh benefits

men_65_75_never_smoked.recommendation: Selective screening based on risk factors

women_65_75_never_smoked.rationale: Very low prevalence (<0.5%), harms may outweigh benefits

other_guidelines.svs: One-time screening for: All men 65+ with smoking history, Men 55+ with family history, Women 65+ with smoking history
other_guidelines.aha: Reasonable to screen men ≥65 with smoking history
other_guidelines.uk_nhs: National screening program for all men at age 65

screening_test.coverage: Medicare covers one-time screening for eligible patients

mass_trial.result: 42% reduction in AAA mortality at 10 years

definition.@value: Evidence-based recommendations for population screening for abdominal aortic aneurysm

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Identify patients who should be screened for AAA
Describe the evidence supporting AAA screening
Determine appropriate follow-up based on ultrasound results
clinical_pearls: One-time screening is sufficient if normal
Medicare covers screening for eligible patients
Ever smoked = even one cigarette in a lifetime
Family history of AAA is an indication for earlier screening

medicalCode.description: Ultrasound, abdominal aorta, real-time with image documentation, for screening for AAA
